paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP), familial amyloidotic cardiomyopathy, and central nervous system amyloidosis

functional_data.summary: Around 100 different TTR mutations have been reported, many of which are amyloidogenic.

variants.segregation_data: Dissociation of the TTR tetramer has been reported as a prerequisite for amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The TTR gene is associated with multiple amyloidogenic diseases.
key_quotes: Transthyretin (TTR) constitutes the fibrillar protein found in familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP), familial amyloidotic cardiomyopathy, and central nervous system amyloidosis.
Around 100 different TTR mutations have been reported, many of which are amyloidogenic.

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one TTR variant was mentioned without specific mutation details.
